Class SimpleHashtable

  • java.lang.Object
    • hr.fer.oop.lab2.topic1.collections.SimpleHashtable

  • public class SimpleHashtable
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents simple Hash table

    • Nested Class Summary

      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  SimpleHashtable.TableEntry
      This class represents one slot of table

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SimpleHashtable()
      Default constructor for table It create table with 16 slots
      SimpleHashtable(int capacity)
      Constructor for table If capacity is not potency of number two, then make new capacity New capacity is potency of number two which is first grater value of accepted capacity

      boolean isEmpty()
      This method checks if table is empty
      void put(java.lang.Object key, java.lang.Object value)
      This method add new pair in table With method hashCode() determines in which slot will pair be saved Overflow is not processed, but it puts elements in sequence list If received key that already exists, replace old value with new one
      void remove(java.lang.Object key)
      This method remove pair with received key If that pair is only one, element is null and subtract number of pairs If that pair is first in list, but not the last one, make second pair first
      int size()
      This method return number of pairs saved in table
      int sizeOfTable()
      This method return how many slots table have

      • SimpleHashtable

        public SimpleHashtable(int capacity)

    • Method Detail

      • put

        public void put(java.lang.Object key,
                java.lang.Object value)
        This method add new pair in table With method hashCode() determines in which slot will pair be saved Overflow is not processed, but it puts elements in sequence list If received key that already exists, replace old value with new one
        Parameters:
        key - is a key by which is sort in table
        value - is a value which needs to be put in table

      • get

        public java.lang.Object get(java.lang.Object key)
        This method return value of key
        Parameters:
        key - is key which value is requested
        Returns:
        requested value If list is empty or pair with this key don't exist, return null

        public boolean containsValue(java.lang.Object value)
        This method checks if received value is saved in table
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if it is found, false if not

      • remove

        public void remove(java.lang.Object key)
        This method remove pair with received key If that pair is only one, element is null and subtract number of pairs If that pair is first in list, but not the last one, make second pair first
        Parameters:
        key - is a key of element which is need to be removed
